result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by 12/12/16, or be docketed as a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence. Huber for Day Reporting Center only.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua Steven Ritchie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 100 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 (six) days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for Day Reporting Center ONLY: 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges by December 12, 2016, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.

Defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  Defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson. Joshua Steven Ritchie in custody. Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense informed the Court there is no resolution for this case. Case is to be sent back to Judge Dee, branch 37. Case adjourned to branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie in court with attorney Craig Robert Johnson.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case is transferred to br. 6 for resolution.  lms

15RM012488  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/09/15
Previously issued $150.00 cash bail. Court ordered all other conditions remain the same.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie not in court, in custody and not produced.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.   Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court. Court ordered Bail amended to $25.00 cash bail.   Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Joshua Steven Ritchie in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dee, Br. 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
